doc.field: The Transit Support Facility dataset includes facilties used to support transit operations. These are facilities are not typically used by the general public. This facility uses have been categorized as administrative, garage, police, rail and store.

<?xml version="1.0"?><metadata><idinfo><citation><citeinfo><title>Transit Support Facilities</title><origin>Metropolitan Council - Metro Transit</origin><pubinfo><publish>Metropolitan Council</publish></pubinfo><pubdate>20130718</pubdate><onlink>ftp://gisftp.metc.state.mn.us/SupportFacilities.zip</onlink></citeinfo></citation><descript><abstract>The Transit Support Facility dataset includes facilties used to support transit operations. These are facilities are not typically used by the general public. This facility uses have been categorized as administrative, garage, police, rail and store.</abstract><purpose>To identify all regional facilities supporting transit operations.</purpose><supplinf>Twin Cities 7 County Metropolitan Area and Sherburne County.</supplinf></descript><timeperd><timeinfo><sngdate><caldate>20130718</caldate></sngdate></timeinfo><current>The Transit Support Facility dataset includes facilties used to support transit operations. These are facilities are not typically used by the general public. This facility uses have been categorized as administrative, garage, police, rail and store.</current></timeperd><status><progress>Complete</progress><update>As Needed</update></status><spdom><bounding><westbc>-94.012</westbc><eastbc>-92.732</eastbc><northbc>45.415</northbc><southbc>44.471</southbc></bounding></spdom><keywords><place><placekey>Twin Cities, Anoka County, Carver County, Dakota County, Hennepin County, Ramsey County, Scott County, Washington County</placekey></place><theme><themekey>transit centers, transit system, buses, Metro Transit, transportation, transfer, bus stops</themekey><themekt>None</themekt></theme></keywords><accconst>None</accconst><useconst>None</useconst><browse><browsen>http://www.datafinder.org/metadata/bg/SupportFacilities.jpg</browsen><browsed>Sample map showing the TransitCenters layer.</browsed></browse><crossref><citeinfo><title>Bus shelters, Park and rides, Transit Routes, Hiawatha LRT Stations</title></citeinfo></crossref><native>ArcGIS version 9x</native><ptcontac><cntinfo><cntperp><cntorg>Metropolitan Council - Metro Transit</cntorg><cntper>Julie Quinn</cntper></cntperp><cntpos>Associate Planner, Engineering and Facilities</cntpos><cntaddr><address>560 6th Ave N</address><city>Minneapolis</city><state>MN</state><postal>55411</postal></cntaddr><cntvoice>612.349.7333</cntvoice><cntemail>julie.quinn@metc.state.mn.us</cntemail></cntinfo></ptcontac></idinfo><dataqual><attracc><attraccr>Attributes are compiled from several sources and are considered accurate. See the Entity and Attribute Overview for more details.</attraccr></attracc><logic>The dataset is topologically 'clean'.</logic><complete>Entire 7 county area is covered.</complete><posacc><horizpa><horizpar>Heads-up digitizing referencing aerial photos were used to help locate the transit center.</horizpar></horizpa></posacc><lineage><procstep><procdesc>Locations and attributes were compiled from various sources.</procdesc></procstep><srcinfo><srcscale /></srcinfo></lineage></dataqual><spdoinfo><indspref>None</indspref><direct>Point</direct><mgmg3obj>point shapes</mgmg3obj><mgmg3til>One layer for entire seven county region.</mgmg3til></spdoinfo><eainfo><overview><eaover>Point Attributes:
SupportID: The support facility unique identification number.
ACTIVE: Is the facility currently utilized.
TCODE: An internal code used for work order management. Not all support facilities will have a TCode.
FAC_TYPE: A general characterization of the use of the facility.
NAME: The name of the support facility.
ADDRESS: The suppor facility address if known.
City: The city the support facility is located in.
Zip: The support facility zip code.
State: The state the support facility is located in.</eaover><eadetcit>None</eadetcit></overview></eainfo><distinfo><resdesc>SupportFacilities</resdesc><distliab>NOTICE: The Geographic Information System (GIS) Data to which this notice is attached are made available pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minnesota Statutes Chapter 13). Doing so will tell your browser to download a 'ZIP' file which will contain the following:
- ArcView shape files - metadata for the dataset (.htm) - NOTICE.RTF, an important notice about this dataset that can be read by any word processing software.
Additionally, this dataset is available for direct use via one or more map services. More information about what a web mapping service is can be found at http://www.datafinder.org/services/.
